case_title: MUHAMMAD SIDDIQUE And Other vs THE STATE

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Siddique and Others
allegation: Unlawful occupation of 100 kanals of state land in Blocks 442/11 and 442/12

complaint_summary: Petitioners occupied state land unlawfully and requested regularization of possession.
investigation_summary: Petitioners were allotted 100 kanals of land under the Abadkari Scheme in Block 422/15, but unlawfully occupied an additional 100 kanals in Blocks 442/11 and 442/12 without legal authority.
judgment_summary: The court denied the request for regularization of unlawfully occupied land but allowed the petitioners to purchase it at the current market price with a 50% penalty and 10% surcharge, payable in six equal half-yearly installments.
punishment: 50% penalty for unauthorized possession and 10% surcharge on market price.
Decision_or_verdict: Petitioners allowed to purchase unlawfully occupied land under specified conditions.
legal_arguments: Petitioners pleaded leniency due to long-term affiliation with the land since migration.

assets.description: 100 kanals of land in Block No. 442/11 and 442/12
assets.location: Chak No. 3/BC, Tehsil and District Bahawalpur

assets.description: 100 kanals of land in Block No. 422/15
assets.location: Chak No. 3/BC, Tehsil and District Bahawalpur

key_issues: Purchase of state land at market price

legal_terms.Abadkari Scheme: A government scheme for allotment of land to migrants.

words_and_phrases.Proprietary Rights: Legal ownership rights granted to the petitioners for lawfully occupied land.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioners occupied state land unlawfully and sought regularization. Court denied regularization but allowed purchase with penalties and surcharges due to long-term affiliation with the land.
